intro: Renealmia scaposa, commonly known as the scapose renealmia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale blue flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or wetlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
